steps.title: Draw a circle and a half oval.
steps.content: Draw a circle and a half oval. Sketch in guidelines. This will help you draw the facial features in the next step.

steps.title: Add important features.
steps.content: Add important features. This includes Voldemort's eyes, mouth, and ears. Just put two slits for the nose. His eyes are described as being red, cat-like slits, his lips thin, and skin bloodless and pale.

steps.title: Add in more details.
steps.content: Add in more details. Remember that Voldemort has no hair whatsoever.

steps.title: Outline your drawing with permanent media such as ink or painting.
steps.content: Outline your drawing with permanent media such as ink or painting. If you want, you can also add shadows and highlights to make it more realistic. Make sure to erase all your pencil guidelines.

steps.title: Color the drawing if you wish.
steps.content: Color the drawing if you wish. Keep his coloring very pale and make his skin close to the color white, or very pale gray- beige. If you make a mistake, you can use the Tombow mono eraser. It is a useful tool for erasing. It gets deep into the surface. It's small and helps to erase precisely. It also helps to create texture or effects by erasing areas with a particular stroke or repetition.
